alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 10:15AM CDT until June 06 at 10:26AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas and Missouri... Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall over the basin will cause rivers to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From this evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 38.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 43.5 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
